revised_title: Discovery of the Pelorosaurus and Its Significance in the Ancient Fauna
tldr: The author, Gideon Algernon Mantell, describes the discovery of a new gigantic terrestrial reptile, the Pelorosaurus, found in the Tilgate Forest strata. The Pelorosaurus humerus is the largest ever discovered, surpassing the Iguanodon in size. The author also discusses the possible physical conditions of the ancient countries inhabited by these reptiles and their relationship to modern faunas.
